objects.moduledoc: Top level context for SurveyTool API.
The entry point for the Survey Tool to run.
Module concerned with outputting content to `stdout`.
Module representing the overall header for a report.
Module representing the the participation count on a report.
Module representing the participation percentage on a report.

Module representing the body of a survey question
and its answers on a report.

Module representing the theme title of a set of questions
on a report.
Module representing the overall title for a survey report.
Responsible for parsing content in question and answer CSV files.
Module representing a rating question type question in a survey.
Module representing a single select question type question in a survey.
Module representing a survey with questions and responses.

objects.name: start
objects.doc:
Starts the survey tool, performs all operations, and handles any
premature exiting of the program.

objects.name: output
objects.doc: Formats and outputs a message or list of messages to `stdout`.

objects.name: parse
objects.doc:
Parses a list of arguments and either returns a set of questions
and responses for a survey, or outputs a message to the console
and halts operation.

objects.name: output
objects.doc: Outputs the report content to the console.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds the header row to the report table.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds the participation count to a report table.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds the participation percentage to the report table.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds a question and its answers to a report table.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds the title for a given theme to a report table.

objects.name: row
objects.doc: Adds the title to a report table.

objects.name: generate_survey
objects.doc:
Reads and parses the set of questions from a given CSV file
and initialises a `%Survey{}` struct to hold the resulting list
of questions.

objects.name: populate_survey
objects.doc:
Maps responses contained in a given CSV file to questions in
a `survey` and populates the survey with any relevant answers
to the questions.

objects.name: add_answer
objects.doc:
Adds an answer to a given `question`.

An answer will only be added to the question under the
following conditions:

- the answer is not `nil`
- the answer is an integer
- the answer falls with the accepted numerical range

objects.name: average_score
objects.doc:
Calculates the average score for a given question.
No score is calculated for questions that have no scores.

objects.name: add_answer
objects.doc:
Adds an answer to a given question and keeps a tally of how
many times the answer occurs for the question.

objects.name: participation_percentage
objects.doc:
Calculates the percentage of responses in the survey that
are considered to be participated.
